message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about improving the performance of Neural Machine Translation (NMT) by incorporating Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) into the NMT framework. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) which covers topics related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as auxiliary classifiers and gating functions, which suggest that it could also be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves training the models in an end-to-end manner, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed approach on multiple NIST test sets, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
